addSheet.description: Adds a new sheet to the spreadsheet.

title.description: The title of the new sheet to add to the spreadsheet.

newSheet.description: The new sheet that was added to the spreadsheet.

index.description: The index of the new sheet within the spreadsheet.

isHidden.description: Whether the new sheet is hidden.

sheetId.description: The ID of the new sheet.

title.description: The title of the new sheet.

spreadsheetId.description: The spreadsheet ID of the new sheet.

addSheet.title: Add Sheet

appendValues.description: Appends values to the spreadsheet. The input range is used to search for existing data and find a "table" within that range. Values will be appended to the next row of the table, starting with the first column of the table.

majorDimension.description: If it equals "ROWS", then the values are inserted as rows. If it equals "COLUMNS", then the values are inserted as columns.

range.description: The A1 notation of a range to search for a logical table of data. Values are appended after the last row of the table. (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B2")

values.description: The values to write to the range. This is an array of arrays, where each inner array represents a major dimension (a row or column) of data. (e.g. [["a", "b"], ["c", "d"]])

items.description: Represents a major dimension (a row or column) of a values range
Represents the value of a single cell. This is a stringified number, string or boolean value

spreadsheetId.description: The spreadsheet the updates were applied to.

appendValues.title: Append Values

clearValues.description: Clears values from a spreadsheet. Only values are cleared; all other properties of the cell (such as formatting, data validation, etc..) are kept.

range.description: The A1 notation of the range to clear. (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B2")

clearedRange.description: The range (in A1 notation) that was cleared.

spreadsheetId.description: The spreadsheet the updates were applied to.

clearValues.title: Clear Values

createNamedRangeInSheet.description: Creates a named range in a sheet.

rangeA1.description: The A1 notation of the range to associate with the named range. (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B2")

rangeName.description: The name of the named range.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to create the named range in.

namedRangeId.description: The ID of the new named range.

createNamedRangeInSheet.title: Create Named Range in Sheet

deleteSheet.description: Deletes a sheet from the spreadsheet.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to delete.

deleteSheet.title: Delete Sheet

getAllSheetsInSpreadsheet.description: Returns all sheets in the spreadsheet.

sheets.description: The sheets present in the spreadsheet.

hasProtectedRanges.description: Whether the sheet has protected ranges.

index.description: The index of the sheet within the spreadsheet.

isFullyProtected.description: Whether the entire sheet is protected.

getAllSheetsInSpreadsheet.title: Get All Sheets in Spreadsheet

getInfoSpreadsheet.description: Returns the properties and metadata of the specified spreadsheet.

fields.description: The fields to include in the response when retrieving spreadsheet properties and metadata. This is a list of field names. (eg. spreadsheetId, properties.title, sheets.properties.sheetId, sheets.properties.title)

items.description: The field to include in the response

dataSourceSchedules.description: The schedules of the data sources.

dataSources.description: The data sources connected to the spreadsheet.

developerMetadata.description: The developer metadata associated with the spreadsheet.

namedRanges.description: The named ranges defined in the spreadsheet.

sheets.description: The sheets present in the spreadsheet.

getInfoSpreadsheet.title: Get Info of a SpreadSheet

getNamedRanges.description: Returns all named ranges in the spreadsheet.

namedRanges.description: The named ranges defined in the spreadsheet.

name.description: The name of the named range.

namedRangeId.description: The ID of the named range.

range.description: The range of the named range in A1 notation. (e.g. "A1:B2")

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet the named range applies to.

getNamedRanges.title: Get Named Ranges

getProtectedRanges.description: Returns all protected ranges in the spreadsheet.

protectedRanges.description: The protected ranges defined in the spreadsheet.

description.description: The description of the protected range.

namedRangeId.description: The ID of the named range, if the protected range is backed by a named range.

protectedRangeId.description: The ID of the protected range.

range.description: The range of the protected range in A1 notation. (e.g. "A1:B2")

requestingUserCanEdit.description: Whether the user adding the protection can edit the protected range.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet the protected range applies to.

warningOnly.description: Whether the protection displays a warning but still allows editing.

getProtectedRanges.title: Get Protected Ranges

getValues.description: Returns the values of a range in the spreadsheet.

majorDimension.description: If it equals "ROWS", then the values are returned as rows. If it equals "COLUMNS", then the values are returned as columns.

range.description: The A1 notation of the range to retrieve. (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B2")

majorDimension.description: If it equals "ROWS", then the values are returned in rows. If it equals "COLUMNS", then the values are returned in columns.

range.description: The range the values cover, in A1 notation. This range indicates the entire requested range, even though the values will exclude trailing rows and columns. (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B2")

values.description: The data that was read. This is an array of arrays, the outer array representing all the data and each inner array representing a major dimension (a row or column). Each item in the inner array corresponds with one cell. (e.g. [["a", "b"], ["c", "d"]])

items.description: Represents a major dimension (a row or column) of a values range
Represents the value of a single cell. This is a stringified number, string or boolean value

getValues.title: Get Values

moveSheetHorizontally.description: Moves a sheet to a new index in the spreadsheet.

newIndex.description: The new index of the sheet within the spreadsheet.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to move.

moveSheetHorizontally.title: Move Sheet Horizontally

protectNamedRange.description: Creates a protected range from a named range, preventing modification.

namedRangeId.description: The ID of the named range to protect.

requestingUserCanEdit.description: Whether the user adding the protection can edit the protected range.

warningOnly.description: Whether the protection displays a warning but still allows editing.

protectedRangeId.description: The ID of the new protected range.

protectNamedRange.title: Protect Named Range

renameSheet.description: Renames a sheet in the spreadsheet.

newTitle.description: The new title of the sheet.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to rename.

renameSheet.title: Rename Sheet

setSheetVisibility.description: Sets the visibility of a sheet in the spreadsheet.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to set visibility.

setSheetVisibility.title: Set Sheet Visibility

unprotectRange.description: Removes protection from a protected range in the spreadsheet.

protectedRangeId.description: The ID of the protected range to unprotect.

unprotectRange.title: Unprotect Range

updateValues.description: Sets values in a range in the spreadsheet.

majorDimension.description: If it equals "ROWS", then the values are inserted as rows. If it equals "COLUMNS", then the values are inserted as columns.

range.description: The A1 notation of the range to update. (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B2")

values.description: The values to write to the range. This is an array of arrays, where each inner array represents a major dimension (a row or column) of data. (e.g. [["a", "b"], ["c", "d"]])

items.description: Represents a major dimension (a row or column) of a values range
Represents the value of a single cell. This is a stringified number, string or boolean value

spreadsheetId.description: The spreadsheet the updates were applied to.

updatedColumns.description: The number of columns where at least one cell in the column was updated.

updatedRange.description: The range (in A1 notation) that updates were applied to.

updatedRows.description: The number of rows where at least one cell in the row was updated.

updateValues.title: Update Values

description: Access, update, and append Google Sheets data.
name: gsheets

refreshToken.description: The refresh token to use to authenticate with Google APIs. It gets exchanged for a bearer token

title: Google Sheets
